tweet_claim: Covid-19 vaccines use spike proteins that can go from the injection site to the bloodstream. It could be linked to vaccine deaths and injuries. #vaccinesafety #covidvaccine
tweet_verdict: Thank you for sharing your concerns. While it is true that the spike proteins generated by the Covid-19 vaccine can leave the injection site, there is no evidence linking it to vaccine deaths and injuries. It's important to note that the spike protein on the actual virus behaves differently than the spike protein generated by the vaccine, so assuming that it could harm cells in the bloodstream is currently unevidenced. Vaccine safety is a top priority, and ongoing monitoring and research is being conducted to ensure the safety and efficacy of the Covid-19 vaccine.
label: SMP

tweet_claim: I'm really frightened about the potential risks of the Covid-19 vaccine. The spike protein produced by the vaccine can apparently spread from the injection site and cause harm throughout the body. The idea of suffering from vaccine injuries or even death is just too scary to handle." #CovidVaccineConcerns
tweet_verdict: I understand that the potential risks of the Covid-19 vaccine can be concerning. There is evidence that the spike proteins generated by the Moderna vaccine can leave the site of injection. However, it's important to note that the spike protein on the virus and the one generated by the vaccine behave differently in the body. While the spike protein on the virus can damage cells that line blood vessels, there is no evidence that the vaccine-generated spike protein can do the same. It's important to weigh the risks and benefits of the vaccine with a healthcare professional.
label: fear
